Author: cenicsoft
Title: BannerCoin ICO BCOIN [Official Announcement]
Body: Want to see the platform behind BannerCoin in action? The BannerView.com website marketing store now accepts Cryptocurrencies alongside credit/debit cards.  The beauty of this system is the seamless integration and checkout process created for end customers. They can simply switch tabs to chose between paying with credit/debit cards and crypto.  All the post order processing on the back end is automated. No need to integrate multiple payment platforms and APIs to accept crypto versus credit/debit cards.

Author: sarul
Title: BannerCoin ICO BCOIN [Official Announcement]
Body: Where we can track how token sales process works? How much your minimum/soft cap to be success on token sale? 100,000,000 supply and up to 50.000.000 BCOINs will be offering on ICO, where's exactly the remaining goes?

Author: cenicsoft
Title: BannerCoin ICO BCOIN [Official Announcement]
Body: We are holding on to the other 50,000,000 that aren't available as part of the sale. We don't yet have a plan to issue those coins. Since we have a redeemable token at a $1 floor, we have an incentive to hold coins closely. Unlike most ICOs, when we sell one of our tokens, we create a future liability should those tokens be redeemed. Very unique way of conducting an ICO.  There's no hard minimum cap, but we are looking to sell at least $1 million USD equivalent. Any unsold coins will be held for future use.  Our ETH smart contract for BCOIN (which has already been generated) has a hard limit so we can't increase supply.

That's why we aren't giving away tokens for nothing! We've attached a certain value to each coin and will be controlling supply tightly.

Author: cenicsoft
Title: BannerCoin ICO BCOIN [Official Announcement]
Body: We've been around manner years. We have shipping products unlike most ICOs. Our ICO is designed as an expansion of an existing product into the crypto space - enabling merchants to accept both traditional credit card payments and digital currencies in a single integrated program.  We'd appreciate the help via Twitter. Anybody that reaches out to us in this thread and helps spread the word, we'll provide some BannerCoin (BCOIN) as tips after the crowdsale is completed. Make sure to register with your Ethereum address on our ICO page - bannercoin.com

Author: Retired
Title: BannerCoin ICO BCOIN [Official Announcement]
Body: You should have made some research to prevent having the same name as other coins. However the concept is interesting.

Author: cenicsoft
Title: BannerCoin ICO BCOIN [Official Announcement]
Body: We've had the BannerCoin name for more than 4 years. The project had been in the works for many months prior to launch and we had a teaser page setup well before others.  As soon as we launched, another coin with a similar name made an announcement (coincidence or trying to bank off our name?). There are some big differences in our projects including the fact that we are mature company with shipping products offering a utility token.  We believe the merits of our project are worth further exploration by potential token sale participants since it's one of the few projects bringing digital currency acceptance to traditional web merchants who might not otherwise get involved in crypto.  The token sale itself will be a live demonstration of our technology at work. It's also the reason why we are accepting 7 different digital currencies as part of the sale.

Author: cenicsoft
Title: BannerCoin ICO BCOIN [Official Announcement]
Body: BannerCoin Initial Coin Offering (ICO) aka Token-Swap    BCOIN Sale Begins Friday, September 15, 2017 at Midnight PDT   Description:  The BannerCoin project is designed to help promote the acceptance and use of various digital currencies by website merchants for purchase of their goods and services. This project will enable the acceptance of digital currencies by these merchants. The BannerCoin token is a cryptocurrency used with BannerCharge that can be redeemed for BannerView.com service credits. All BannerOS customers who use BannerCharge to accept payments via digital currencies will be required to accept the BannerCoin token as a form of payment. There could be a growing market of merchants accepting it for actual goods and services. Each BannerCoin token will be redeemable for one (1) BannerView.com credit. These credits can then be used toward recurring services provided by BannerView.com limited to website hosting and BannerOS related license fees including BannerGrips that are billed on a monthly or other recurring basis at a rate of 1 credit per $1 value of service purchased.  White Paper:  Download Project White Paper  Symbol:  BCOIN Token Type:  BannerCoin is an Ethereum blockchain token based upon the ERC20 standard.  Total supply:  100,000,000 BannerCoin tokens will be created.   BCOIN allocation plan: Up to 50,000,000 BannerCoin tokens will offered in the initial coin offering.   The remaining BannerCoin tokens will be held in reserve for future use such as distribution to employees, third party partners, sold to fund future initiatives or distributed as otherwise needed.  ICO Sale Dates  Start Date:  Token sales will begin on Friday, September 15, 2017 at Midnight PDT.  End Date:  Tuesday, October 31, 2017 at 11:59PM PDT unless extended or when all tokens are sold.  How to purchase BCOIN Tokens  BannerCoin tokens can be purchased in many ways. The following digital currencies at the listed exchange rate will be accepted:   Minimum BannerCoin token purchase via digital currency - 25  Bitcoin  .0007 BTC per 1 BCOIN - minimum purchase .0175 BTC  Dash  .01 DASH per 1 BCOIN - minimum purchase .25 DASH  Ethereum  .007 ETH per 1 BCOIN - minimum purchase .175 ETH  Litecoin  .04 LTC per 1BCOIN - minimum purchase 1 LTC  Monero  .05 XMR per 1BCOIN - minimum purchase 1.25 XMR  Ripple  11 XRP per 1BCOIN - minimum purchase 275 XRP  Zcash  .01 ZEC per 1 BCOIN - minimum purchase .25 ZEC  Other payment options  Wire transfer Contact us for wire instructions  $2.2 per 1 BCOIN minimum 1,000 BCOIN ($2,200)  Credit Card (only open to existing BannerView.com customers)  $2.25 per 1 BCOIN minimum 50 BCOIN ($112.50)  Register to be prepared for the sale and get notified when the sale starts:    Token Distribution Dates  BannerCoin tokens will be issued within 60 days to purchasers who made purchase by wire transfer or other cryptocurrency after the close of the initial coin offering. Purchasers must have an Ethereum wallet in order to receive the purchased tokens.   Sale to those eligible to purchase via credit card will need to wait up to 90 days before receiving their tokens.   All sales of BannerCoin tokens are final. No refunds will be issued.  Use of ICO proceeds  We plan to use the revenue generated via the ICO sale toward further development of the BannerCharge payment system to grow beyond traditional payment acceptance to also accepting many digital currencies directly. This includes hiring developers and support staff along with expanding our data center facility equipment to support a growing digital currency payment ecosystem. In addition, funds will be used for compliance, regulatory needs for running a payments acceptance business, for potential complimentary business acquisitions and other corporate purposes as needed. In light of full disclosure, we are free to use the revenue generated from our sales in any manner seen fit and make no guarantees that the revenue generated from this particular sale will be spent on any specifically announced initiative.  What is BannerCharge and what role does it play in BannerCoin?  BannerCharge is a product that runs on BannerOS, the company's website management platform. BannerCharge works with BannerOS add-on products, called Grips. These Grips enable companies of all sizes to do things from membership management to fully functional ecommerce websites. Many merchants accept traditional credit card payments for products sold via their ecommerce store, paid registration to events, monthly memberships and for products and services invoiced through a billing system. BannerCharge 2.0 already enables this functionality.   We want to take BannerCharge a big leap forward by allowing it to accept payment via digital currencies, not just the big ones like most payment acceptance modules allow such as Bitcoin and Litecoin, but dozens of digital currencies now that digital currencies in general have become a $100+ billion market! In addition, accepting low denomination payments under $1 (micro-payments), via traditional means such as credit cards or even via Bitcoin is way too expensive and inefficient. Using various digital currencies, micro-payments become feasible. For example, if a customer wanted to charge for a white paper of $.50 per download or per view of an article, paying with a digital currency is convenient and inexpensive. Not only that, merchants who accept digital payments don't have to worry about chargebacks and fraud is reduced because digital currency payments are irreversible. This is especially important when your product is delivered immediately, but you could later get a chargeback with no recourse to get your product back. Digitally delivered goods should have a digitally backed payment system!   The development of BannerCharge 3.0 will enable merchants to accept digital currency payments in addition to credit card payments. Initially 8 digital currencies including BannerCoin, Bitcoin, Dash, Ethereum, Litecoin, Monero, Ripple, and Zcash can be accepted by merchants. Merchants will have full control over which currencies they choose to accept, however, the acceptance of at least BannerCoin will be required upon enabling this feature. We estimate that about every two weeks after BannerCharge 3.0 is released, we'll be able to add support for another digital currency. Each time a new currency is added, it will improve the ecosystem for that currency.   BannerCharge isn't a system that converts digital currency payments into fiat currencies (government backed money like the US dollar). It will allow merchants to participate in the growing digital currency market, encourage them to hold and use them.   Because products and services are priced in US dollars, the amount of digital currency required to complete a purchase will still be derived by taking the digital currency's current market value from CoinMarketCap's API and converted into the associated US dollar value. CoinMarketCap pulls data from various exchanges around the world to average the world price of a digital currency. Since digital currency prices fluctuate rapidly, customers paying with digital currencies will have, by default, up to 1 hour to complete the transaction which involves the customer sending the digital currency to the required payment address. This time limit will be modifiable by the merchant in the BannerCharge preferences. Merchants will also be able to set fixed exchange rates if they don't want to use dynamic pricing from CoinMarketCap.   Many digital currencies are increasing in value as fiat currencies inflate. Allowing merchants to hold digital currency brings more awareness and real world use scenarios to cryptocurrencies plus gives them upside potential when those digital currencies increase in value. A major part of our initiative is to expand the actual use of digital currencies for transactions as opposed to only pure speculation. We believe that many merchants holding various digital currencies may be more likely to spend them as opposed to selling them for fiat currency if they actually have places to spend them!  BannerCoin Token Sale Disclaimers  This is not a sale of securities, or offer of sale of securities. There are no voting rights or other implied rights by participating in this initial coin offering. By purchasing BannerCoin tokens, you are becoming a customer of BannerView.com and purchasing a redeemable token. Each token is redeemable for one (1) BannerView.com credit. BannerView.com credits can be used toward recurring services provided by BannerView.com limited to website hosting and BannerOS related license fees including BannerGrips that are billed on a monthly or other recurring basis at a rate of 1 credit per $1 value of service purchased. There is no other assigned or implied cash value beyond the tokens being redeemable for BannerView.com credits. While BannerView.com may, in the future, make purchases of BannerCoin tokens on the open market, it is under no obligation to purchase BannerCoin tokens for cash consideration. ALL SALES of BannerCoin tokens are FINAL. No refunds will be issued!   BannerView.com makes no restrictions on the transferability of BannerCoin tokens. They can be traded, sold or otherwise transferred as seen fit as you would any digital property under the laws of your local jurisdiction. This includes being exchanged for other cryptographic property, or for goods and services at those merchants who decide to accept BannerCoin tokens as a form of payment or trade. Those wishing to redeem BannerCoin tokens for BannerView.com credits will be required to register as a customer with BannerView.com prior to redemption. We only allow token redemptions from customers with whom we can legally conduct business.   There are no guarantees that a market for BannerCoin tokens will develop nor are there guarantees merchants will adopt the acceptance of digital currencies, including BannerCoin tokens.   Once BannerCoin tokens are in your possession, BannerView.com has no control over what you do with the tokens. In the event of theft or loss of BannerCoin tokens, BannerView.com offers no legal liability to refund or retrieve such tokens. Once tokens are moved from one wallet to another, there's no technical ability to reverse a transaction. All transactions of BannerCoin tokens are irreversible. Treat your BannerCoins like you would your physical wallet!  About the Team behind BannerCoin  BannerCoin is being developed by BannerView.com, a Cenicola-Helvin Enterprises brand. BannerView.com is the developer of BannerOS, a premier website analytics and content management software that powers businesses all across the Internet. Get a website built or make your own with our website builder; two great ways to get a website powered by BannerOS. Cenicola-Helvin Enterprises, the Las Vegas based parent company of BannerView.com, was founded in 1999. BannerView.com built its first customer website in early 2000.  Unlike many organizations promoting ICO's, BannerView.com has a proven track record of delivering real products used by real paying customers!   BannerView.com has a self-owned and operated secure data center facility which has been built to both protect the hardware and software it houses. This further shows our commitment to investing in our growth and trust you can place in us on delivering upon our promises.
